itemDescription: British expatriate editor, essayist, author, and sinologist

wikipedia_page.main: Frederic Henry Balfour (1846 – 27 May 1909) was a British expatriate editor, essayist, author, and sinologist, living in Shanghai during the Victorian era. He is most notable for his translation of the Tao Te Ching. Many of these translations appeared in his 1884  Taoist Texts: Ethical, Political and Speculative, also known simply as Taoist Texts.
